sub_theme: ACL injury prevention, core stability assessment
ai_summary: Current concepts review demonstrates that hip and core muscle dysfunction assessment and multi-component neuromuscular interventions reduce ACL injury rates by 20-60% in youth athletes, with larger effects in females.

title: Higher Incidence and Longer Recovery Time from Non-Contact Muscle Injuries in ACTN3 XX Genotype Players from a Soccer Academy: A Three-Season Longitudinal Study
abstract: Abstract Objective The purpose of this study was to examine whether the ACTN3 R577X polymorphism was associated with injury rate and recovery time from non-contact muscle injuries in youth academy players and professional soccer players. Methods The ACTN3 rs1815739 genotype was identified in 76 male
sub_theme: ACTN3 polymorphism, non-contact muscle injury risk, youth soccer
ai_summary: Three-season prospective study of 76 male soccer players shows ACTN3 XX genotype carriers have significantly longer recovery time (18 days median) from non-contact muscle injuries compared to RR carriers (13 days), particularly in U17 youth players.

title: Clinical applications of wearable sensor-based gait analysis in athletes: a systematic review for injury prevention and rehabilitation
journal: BMC Sports Science Medicine and Rehabilitation
abstract: Wearable sensor-based gait analysis shows emerging evidence of providing objective biomechanical insights that may support injury risk assessment and rehabilitation monitoring in athletic populations. Evidence from moderate-quality observational studies indicates that simple, well-placed sensors may
sub_theme: Wearable sensors, gait analysis, return-to-play monitoring
ai_summary: Systematic review of wearable sensor-based gait analysis demonstrates that tibial accelerometers and trunk-mounted IMUs provide objective biomechanical insights for injury risk assessment and rehabilitation monitoring in athletic populations.

sub_theme: Goal setting, injury rehabilitation, return-to-play motivation
ai_summary: Quasi-experimental study of 38 injured athletes in Nigeria shows structured goal-setting intervention significantly improves injury rehabilitation outcomes (F=110.81, η²=0.79) by enhancing psychological readiness and motivation for return-to-play.

title: Perceptions of Biomechanical Devices in Collegiate Baseball Pitchers and Training Staff: A Qualitative Study
journal: International Journal of Sports Physical Therapy

sub_theme: wearable biomechanical devices, implementation barriers and facilitators
ai_summary: Qualitative study of collegiate baseball pitchers and training staff identified barriers (data interpretation, systemization challenges) and facilitators (individualized data, athlete empowerment, injury prevention appreciation) for adoption of wearable biomechanical monitoring devices.

title: Adverse Effects of Pain Medication Used in Sport Medicine
abstract: Background: Acute and chronic pain is a very common problem amongst people involved in sports, whether professionally or recreationally. Most of them require the use of medication in order to alleviate the pain. Extensive use of pain medication is burdened with an increased risk of adverse effects.
sub_theme: pain medication adverse effects, NSAIDs, opioids, gabapentinoids
ai_summary: A narrative review summarized adverse effects of common pain medications in sports medicine, finding that NSAIDs increase gastrointestinal bleeding risk, acetaminophen causes hepatotoxicity, and gabapentinoids produce somnolence and dizziness, with recommendations for short-term acute pain management.

title: Retinal Detachment Risk Among Athletes: Incidence, Predisposing Factors and Preventive Strategies
abstract: Background: Retinal detachment is a severe emergency that can lead to permanent vision loss and other complications if not promptly treated. sub_theme: retinal detachment, ocular trauma, eye protection
ai_summary: Systematic review of retinal detachment incidence in athletes across sports, identifying collision sports as high-risk and demonstrating that 90% of sport-related ocular injuries are preventable with proper eye protection.

title: Superstar Effects in the WNBA: Is Caitlin Clark the First WNBA Superstar?
abstract: This study quantifies superstar effects in the Women's National Basketball Association (WNBA), by examining how star players impact game attendance, with particular focus on 2024 rookie Caitlin Clark. sub_theme: superstar effects on attendance
ai_summary: Panel regression analysis of WNBA attendance data (1997–2024) found Caitlin Clark generated unprecedented superstar effects of +7,900 and +6,400 fans for home and away games respectively, exceeding Michael Jordan's NBA impact.

title: Network analysis and link prediction in competitive women's basketball
abstract: Network structure and its role in prediction are examined in competitive basketball at the team and player levels. sub_theme: network analysis and link prediction
ai_summary: Network analysis using node2vec embeddings on NCAA Division I women's basketball and WNBA data demonstrated that higher-order network structure (game outcomes, shot-blocking, passing) contains statistically significant predictive signals for future match outcomes and player interactions.

title: A Comparative Study of Mental Toughness among College-Going Female Athletes and Non-Athletes in Bengaluru
abstract: Abstract Mental toughness is widely recognized as an essential psychological attribute influencing performance, resilience, stress management, and adaptability in both sports and academic environments. The present study aimed to examine and compare the levels of mental toughness among college-going
sub_theme: mental toughness in female athletes
ai_summary: Female college athletes demonstrated significantly higher mental toughness scores than non-athlete peers (n=120), supporting the psychological benefits of organized competitive sports participation in higher education.

abstract: The 50 meter freestyle is a sprint event that requires explosive strength, efficient technique, and optimal body stability. sub_theme: arm and core muscle strength in freestyle sprint
ai_summary: Arm muscle strength significantly predicted 50-meter freestyle performance in young swimmers (r=0.773), while core strength showed positive but non-significant correlation; combined variables explained 57.7% of swimming speed variance.

abstract: Objectives. sub_theme: women's sporting achievements and development in Kerala

title: Inside-Out and Outside-In: Dual Pathways of Grit Development in Youth Powerlifting

title: Embodied Translation, Multimodal, and Situated Communication
abstract: This ethnographic study explores how multilingual athletes in Macau’s rink hockey and football teams translate strategy, affect, and identity across linguistic, bodily, and material boundaries. sub_theme: multilingual communication, translanguaging in team sports
ai_summary: An ethnographic study reveals how multilingual athletes in rink hockey and football teams negotiate meaning across linguistic, bodily, and material boundaries through translanguaging and intersemiotic translation.

title: The Synergy of Wearable Optical Heart Rate Sensor Technology and Box Breathing in Real-Time Decision Making in Precision, Explosive, and Intermittent Sports

sub_theme: decision-making, box breathing, heart rate regulation, wearable sensors

abstract: Background. sub_theme: PTSD risk prediction in military personnel using MARSplines
ai_summary: A Multivariate Adaptive Regression Splines machine learning model achieved 70.3% accuracy and sensitivity of 71.1% in predicting PTSD risk in 4,403 military personnel, supporting design of sport-based prevention and rehabilitation programs.

title: Organizational practices that champion people and performance: a case study of Speed Skating Canada

sub_theme: organizational culture, leadership, athlete wellbeing

title: Targeted saliva multi-omics is a reliable, non-invasive method to capture physiological stress and recovery

title: Return to Sports After Primary Total Knee Arthroplasty: A Prospective Cohort Study of 1782 Patients

sub_theme: return to sport after total knee arthroplasty, RTS outcomes

title: Predicting college students’ exercise dependence: a machine learning approach

sub_theme: exercise dependence risk prediction in college students

sub_theme: gait analysis and movement assessment

title: Muscle, Neuromuscular, and Cardiac Damage in Trail Running: A Systematic Review

sub_theme: trail running muscle cardiac damage eccentric loading

sub_theme: overtraining syndrome biomarkers

sub_theme: gender differences in leadership competencies

sub_theme: disordered eating, body dissatisfaction, coach and teammate influence

sub_theme: physical literacy in physical education teacher training

sub_theme: physical activity maintenance in hip and knee osteoarthritis
ai_summary: Systematic review of qualitative studies on physical activity maintenance in hip and knee osteoarthritis identified therapeutic alliance, ongoing support, and collaborative goal-setting as key factors influencing continued activity adherence post-intervention.

ai_summary: Online consultation guidelines 'Bewust Bewegen' were developed and implemented to support healthcare professionals in providing brief evidence-based physical activity advice to patients with chronic diseases, with 555 professionals registered and average satisfaction rating of 7.8/10.

sub_theme: surgical procedure costs, ambulatory vs hospital settings
ai_summary: Ambulatory surgery centers (ASC) demonstrated significantly lower total costs for hip arthroscopy ($3,543 vs $6,209), rotator cuff repair, and ACL reconstruction with shorter operative times compared to hospital outpatient departments in a publicly funded healthcare model.

title: General and sports nutrition knowledge among nutritionists in Jordan
abstract: Introduction: Nutrition knowledge is crucial for enhancing athletes’ performance, yet few studies have examined general and sports nutrition knowledge among nutritionists. sub_theme: sports nutrition knowledge, nutritionists
ai_summary: Cross-sectional survey of 394 Jordanian nutritionists revealed 39.6% had poor sports nutrition knowledge, with deficits associated with gender, BMI, education level, experience, and lack of regular exercise.

title: Sex-Specific Associations Between Repetitive Head Impact Exposure and Cerebral Blood Flow Among Active Amateur Soccer Players
abstract: Repetitive head impacts (RHIs) in soccer have been associated with long-term risk for neurodegenerative disease. The pathophysiology is largely unknown. sub_theme: repetitive head impacts, cerebral blood flow, sex differences, soccer
ai_summary: MRI study of 82 amateur soccer players (48.9% female) found athletes with repetitive head impact exposure had higher cerebral blood flow globally and in sex-specific brain regions, with associations to neuropsychological outcomes.

title: The Role of Social Support and Perfectionist Climate in the Development of Sports Persistence
abstract: Sport persistence is a key factor in maintaining a sporting career and preventing dropout from sport. sub_theme: sports persistence, social support, perfectionist climate, youth athletes
ai_summary: Cross-sectional study of 1,105 young athletes (14-25 years) found parental and teacher support positively predicted sports persistence, while peer support had no effect; perfectionist expectations helped but criticism harmed persistence, with gender-mediated effects.

title: Time-to-Injury Forecasting in Elite Female Football: A DeepHit Survival Approach
abstract: Injury occurrence in football poses significant challenges for athletes and teams, carrying personal, competitive, and financial consequences. sub_theme: time-to-injury forecasting, survival modeling, elite female footballers
ai_summary: DeepHit neural network applied to longitudinal athlete monitoring data from elite female footballers achieved concordance index of 0.762, outperforming baseline models and providing interpretable, time-varying injury risk estimates.

abstract: The purpose of the study. This study examined whether perceived coach etiquette predicts intrinsic and extrinsic sport motivation among collegiate softball and baseball athletes in a selected Philippine university. sub_theme: coach etiquette, athlete motivation, collegiate softball and baseball
ai_summary: Survey of 45 collegiate softball and baseball athletes found perceived coach etiquette did not significantly predict intrinsic or extrinsic motivation, though coaches' etiquette was moderately perceived as respectful.

title: Preoperative expectations for return to sports and outcomes following anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction: a survey of adolescent patients and their parents
abstract: Limited data exists on adolescent athletes’ and their parents’ expectations for return to sport (RTS) and outcomes following anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction (ACLR). sub_theme: ACL reconstruction, return-to-sport expectations
ai_summary: Adolescent athletes anticipate earlier return to sport after ACL reconstruction (32% within 6 months) compared to their parents (14%), though both groups had high performance expectations, with fear of reinjury being the primary barrier to return.

title: Sex-Based Differences in Cell Types and Gene Expression within the Anterior Cruciate Ligament
journal: Journal of Bone and Joint Surgery

sub_theme: ACL injury sex differences, gene expression, progenitor cells
ai_summary: Single-cell RNA sequencing of ACL tissue from 9 patients (4 male, 5 female) identified sex-based differences in fibroblast progenitor cells, with female cells showing higher expression of collagen degradation genes, potentially explaining higher female ACL tear rates.

title: Death Rates of Elite and Professional American Athletes During Early Adulthood are Lower than the General Population
abstract: This study aimed to assess rates of death of elite and professional young adult athletes in different US sports, comparing to the general population. sub_theme: mortality rates, elite athletes, sex differences
ai_summary: Analysis of 54,648 male and 6,280 female elite US athletes from 17 sports showed significantly lower mortality rates (SMR 0.49 for males, 0.38 for females) in early adulthood compared to general population, except in high-risk sports like auto racing and mountaineering.

title: Design Requirements of a Novel Wearable System for Safety and Performance Monitoring in Women’s Soccer
abstract: Female soccer is rapidly becoming a widely practiced sport at different levels: this opens up a new demand for systems meant to protect athletes from head impacts or to monitor their effects. sub_theme: head impact monitoring, wearable sensors, women's soccer safety
ai_summary: Engineered design of a low-cost wearable head band system with IMU and pressure sensors for monitoring head impacts and performance in women's soccer, addressing safety needs specific to female players.

abstract: Background: Structural abnormalities assessed with conventional ultrasound (US) or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) are associated with the risk of developing patellar tendinopathy (PT). sub_theme: patellar tendinopathy, imaging prognostics, exercise therapy outcomes
ai_summary: Cohort study of 76 athletes with patellar tendinopathy found no significant association between baseline ultrasound or MRI imaging abnormalities and 24-week pain/disability outcomes after exercise therapy.

sub_theme: shoulder dislocation, reduction timing

Fifty-three male participants aged 18 to 25 were included in this randomised controlled study. Participants w
sub_theme: cryotherapy, muscle function, return-to-play
ai_summary: Randomized controlled trial compares cold spray versus cold pack effects on quadriceps muscle function, strength, and activation in male participants, finding cold spray improves muscle strength.

title: All BANG, little buck: Need-related experiences are weakly linked with behavior in the video game domain
abstract: Psychological theories of media use often assume that subjective motivation affects observable behavior. Using video games as a test case, we examine this assumption by pairing repeated self-reports of motivation with objective digital trace data at scale. Across two datasets comprising tens of thou
sub_theme: motivation, engagement, basic needs in games
ai_summary: Large-scale study linking self-reported motivational needs (autonomy, competence, relatedness) to objective gaming behavior finds weak associations between need satisfaction and play duration or session patterns.

ai_summary: An experimental training program based on tactical situations significantly improved perceptual-motor capabilities and offensive positioning in young football players compared to controls, as measured by video and GPS analysis.

sub_theme: sex-based differences in shoulder and hip joint position, mobility, and clubhead velocity
ai_summary: In 24 elite golfers (12 male, 12 female), hip joint range of motion showed opposite correlations with clubhead velocity between sexes (r=0.71 for males, r=-0.58 for females), and males demonstrated greater left hip internal rotation, indicating sex-specific skeletal adaptations requiring tailored conditioning protocols.

abstract: Abstract Background Anxiety and depressive symptoms are common in elite sports but remain understudied in female professional beach volleyball. ai_summary: A cross-sectional study of 52 elite female beach volleyball players in the FIVB top 200 found that 67.3% exceeded clinical thresholds for trait anxiety and 71.2% for depressive symptoms, with poor team communication and financial insecurity as significant predictors.

sub_theme: doping control analysis, dried blood spots

title: All BANG, little buck: Need-related experiences are weakly linked with behavior in the video game domain

title: Identifying individual playing roles in professional and semi-professional male and female basketball players. A systematic review
abstract: Introduction. Basketball is a globally popular sport requiring optimization of players’ physical, physiological, psychological, and tactical performance. sub_theme: individual playing roles identification in professional and semi-professional players
ai_summary: A systematic review of 12 studies on basketball individual playing roles found methodological heterogeneity across studies and identified seven recurrent playing roles (paint protector, shooter, role player, floor general, defensive player, versatile player, explosive player), emphasizing the need for standardized frameworks.

title: Sex and performance‐level differences in aerobic and haematological parameters among elite ski mountaineering athletes
abstract: Abstract Ski mountaineering (SkiMo) is a new Olympic sport with extreme endurance demands and altitude exposure. sub_theme: aerobic and haematological parameters in elite ski mountaineers
ai_summary: In 29 elite ski mountaineering athletes, hemoglobin mass normalized to body mass strongly correlated with VO2max in both sexes, but elite Tier 5 athletes achieved superior aerobic performance without higher hemoglobin mass, suggesting additional physiological factors drive elite performance.

sub_theme: plyometric training on soft versus hard surfaces for explosive power and balance
ai_summary: A randomized controlled trial of 42 adolescent female basketball players found that six weeks of plyometric training on soft (unstable) surfaces produced greater improvements in vertical jump, dynamic balance, and static balance compared to hard-surface or conventional training.

title: Rethinking Energy Availability from Conceptual Models to Applied Practice: A Narrative Review

ai_summary: Study of adolescent males in mini-football, volleyball, swimming, boxing, and track-and-field demonstrates trained athletes exhibit significantly higher vital lung capacity and ventilatory efficiency, with overtraining manifesting as reduced ventilatory efficiency and autonomic imbalance.

sub_theme: ludotechnical model, youth training, motivation

abstract: OBJECTIVE: To describe the prevalence and predictors for upper extremity injury in pickleball players. sub_theme: upper extremity injury prevalence and risk factors
ai_summary: A cross-sectional survey of 1,758 pickleball players found that 39.3% reported upper extremity injuries annually, with male sex, increased play frequency, shorter play history, and low perceived injury prevention importance as significant predictors.

abstract: Background/Objectives: The aim of our study was to evaluate the transverse stiffness of selected soft tissues in the knee joint region on the previously injured and uninjured sides of female handball players and non-athlete women, in the lying and standing positions, and to investigate the relations
sub_theme: knee injury, soft tissue stiffness, functional outcomes
ai_summary: In female handball players with previous knee injury, patellar tendon stiffness was significantly higher than controls but negatively correlated with clinical knee function assessments, suggesting a maladaptive response.

title: Case Report: Hyperlactation and Sport Performance in an Elite Marathon Runner

As elite athletes are increasingly choosing to have children and return to high level competition, it is important to explore t
sub_theme: hyperlactation and marathon performance in elite female endurance athlete
ai_summary: A case report of an elite female marathon runner suggests that hyperlactation may negatively influence endurance performance, indicating a need for further research on the intersection of lactation and exercise physiology.

title: Promoting psychosocial development in young soccer players using hybrid learning

abstract: Psychosocial attributes are an important element of talent development in young soccer players which may account for future selection, life skills, and performance outcomes. sub_theme: psychosocial skills, youth development, hybrid learning
ai_summary: A mixed-methods thesis using systematic review, e-Delphi, interviews, and thematic analysis identifies key psychosocial attributes (motivational, regulatory, interpersonal) for youth soccer development and provides recommendations for implementing hybrid learning to support these skills in young players.

title: Anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction in elite and professional athletes: does graft choice influence return to sport and failure rate? A systematic review and meta-analysis
abstract: Background: Different grafts are used for anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) reconstruction, but their impact on return to sport (RTS) in elite and professional athletes remains unclear. sub_theme: ACL reconstruction graft choice, return to sport

title: Missing pieces, new patterns: the impact of association football international call-ups on team offensive and defensive performance indicators
abstract: Introduction To examine how mid-season international call-ups (AFCON and AFC Asian Cup) affect club performance across offensive, defensive, and playing-style key performance indicators (KPIs). ai_summary: Analysis of 522 matches from Europe's top five leagues showing that during mid-season international absences, clubs demonstrated more possession-oriented play, enhanced attacking output (more shots, goals, progressive passes), and maintained defensive performance despite squad rotation.

title: Observation and technical analysis of curve performance in inline speed skating: a systematic review
abstract: Introduction: inline speed skating remains underexplored in scientific literature, especially on curved sections of the track. sub_theme: curve performance, push-off mechanics, technique

sub_theme: sex and gender equity in exercise physiology research
ai_summary: Analysis of 629 exercise physiology articles (2018-2020) found severe gender inequities: 46% studied only males, women represented only 27% of authors and 16% of senior authors, and most studies showed poor adherence to SAGER sex/gender reporting guidelines.

sub_theme: physiotherapy strength training, injury incidence reduction

abstract: This study aimed to understand the perceptions of mental toughness among elite swimmers. sub_theme: mental toughness, elite swimmers, perceptions

title: Impact of mental and physiological fatigue on attentional focus in basketball players: a systematic review

ai_summary: Systematic review of 5 studies found that both mental and physical fatigue disrupt attentional focus and impair basketball performance, with mental fatigue consistently impairing decision-making and physical fatigue reducing shooting accuracy.

abstract: Objectives This systematic review and meta-analysis examined the effects of plyometric training (PT) on the physical fitness of adolescent team-sport athletes. title: Acute Effects of Three Recovery Interventions on Post-Practice Vertical Jump Force-Time Metrics in Female Basketball Players
journal: Journal of Functional Morphology and Kinesiology
abstract: Objectives: The purpose of the present study was to investigate the acute effects of cold-water immersion (CWI), cryotherapy (CRT), and intermittent pneumatic compression (IPC) on lower-body neuromuscular performance in female basketball players. Methods: Eighteen athletes volunteered to participate
sub_theme: recovery modalities, cryotherapy, cold water immersion
ai_summary: Study of 18 female basketball players found cold-water immersion, cryotherapy, and pneumatic compression were no more effective than passive recovery in mitigating post-practice declines in lower-body force and power metrics.

title: The influence of the menstrual cycle on muscle injuries - a systematic review and meta-analysis
abstract: This systematic review and meta-analysis examined the relationship between menstrual cycle phases and the incidence of muscle injuries in female team sport athletes, following PRISMA 2020 and PERSiST guidelines. A comprehensive search was conducted in PubMed, Scopus, and SPORTDiscus from inception t
sub_theme: menstrual cycle, muscle injury risk
ai_summary: Meta-analysis of 3 studies in 318 female team-sport athletes found no statistically significant association between menstrual cycle phase and muscle injury risk (RR=1.18), but evidence certainty was very low due to methodological limitations.

title: Exploring Coaches' Responses to Interpersonal Violence in Sport: Recognition, Severity Perception, and Likelihood of Reporting.
journal: Open Access CRIS of the University of Bern
abstract: Coaches play a critical role in safeguarding athletes from interpersonal violence (IV), yet their ability to recognize, evaluate, and address such incidents remains understudied. This study explored coaches' accuracy in recognizing violent and ambiguous scenarios, their perception of severity, and t
sub_theme: interpersonal violence, safeguarding, coach recognition
ai_summary: Survey of 145 coaches found they failed to recognize 30% of violent scenarios and only correctly classified 45% of ambiguous cases, with psychological factors influencing severity perception and reporting likelihood.

abstract: Coaches play a critical role in safeguarding athletes from interpersonal violence (IV), yet their ability to recognize, evaluate, and address such incidents remains understudied. This study explored coaches’ accuracy in recognizing violent and ambiguous scenarios, their perception of severity, and t
sub_theme: interpersonal violence, safeguarding, coach recognition
ai_summary: Survey of 145 coaches found they failed to recognize 30% of violent scenarios and only correctly classified 45% of ambiguous cases, with psychological factors influencing severity perception and reporting likelihood.

title: Perception of Pain and Function Among Athletes and Parents: A PROMIS Dyad Study
journal: The American Journal of Sports Medicine
abstract: Background: Athletes can be profoundly impacted by their environment and support system. For young, injured athletes, parents may wield significant influence over their treatment and recovery, yet may hold divergent perceptions of the athletes’ condition. Hypothesis: When using the Patient-Reported
sub_theme: injury perception, parent-athlete dyad, pain interference
ai_summary: Study of 387 injured athlete-parent dyads found parents consistently rated pain interference and functional limitations as worse than athletes (mean difference 5 points), across football, soccer, gymnastics, and basketball.

title: Monitoring Resistance Training Intensity Using Load-Intercept from The Load-Velocity Relationship Variables: The Case of Deadlift
journal: Journal of Sports Science and Medicine
abstract: <p>This study aimed to investigate the feasibility of using deadlift load-velocity (L-V) relationship variables, specifically the load-intercept (<italic>L<sub>0</sub></italic>), to monitor resistance training intensity. Fifteen well-trained male and fifteen well-traine
sub_theme: load-velocity relationship, deadlift, training intensity
ai_summary: Study of 30 well-trained athletes found load-intercept from deadlift load-velocity relationships offers acceptable reliability (CV=4.98%) for monitoring high-intensity training (≥80% 1RM) but not low-intensity ranges.

title: High return to play but low return to preinjury level after anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction in soccer players: A systematic review with meta‐analysis
abstract: Abstract Purpose This systematic review with meta‐analysis aimed to quantify return to play (RTP) outcomes in soccer players after anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction (ACLR), including the rate of RTP, time to RTP, rate of return to preinjury level of sport, and secondary ACL injury. Additiona
sub_theme: ACL reconstruction, return to play, return to preinjury level
ai_summary: A meta-analysis of 39 studies (7,452 soccer players) found 83% return-to-play rate after ACL reconstruction but only 60% returned to preinjury level, with higher RTP and lower reinjury rates in males and elite athletes.

title: Impact of Individual-Specific Strength Exercises on Knee Muscle Strength and Speed Performance in Speed Skaters: A Randomised Control Trial
abstract: Background: Speed skating performance relies heavily on lower limb strength, neuromuscular control, and coordination. Weakness of knee muscles can limit performance and increase the risk of overuse injuries. Individual-specific strengthening of knee flexors and extensors may enhance strength and ska
sub_theme: strength training, knee muscle development
ai_summary: Individual-specific knee strengthening exercises significantly improved knee flexor/extensor strength and inline skating speed in young speed skaters (aged 8-14) over 8 weeks compared to controls.

title: Hexagonal agility test time measurement device: a sensor-based smartphone solution
abstract: Introduction: Traditional agility measurements often rely on stopwatches and human responses, leading to low accuracy and consistency. Sensors have been used in some agility tests, but not in hexagonal agility test (HAT). Objective: This study develops a digital and Android-based automated timing me
sub_theme: automated agility testing, sensor-based measurement, smartphone technology
ai_summary: An automated Android-based timing device for the hexagonal agility test demonstrated high reliability (ICC: 0.9) with improved consistency and speed compared to manual stopwatch measurement in 42 university students.

title: On-Pitch Use of Mobile Devices: An Acceptance Study Among German Elite Youth Football Coaches
journal: FuG – Zeitschrift für Fußball und Gesellschaft
abstract: Through 19 in-depth interviews with youth academy coaches at different levels, this study investigates the acceptance of mobile devices among elite youth football coaches in Germany, focusing on the integration of smartphones and tablets for on-pitch use. While mobile devices provide opportunities f
sub_theme: mobile device acceptance, technology integration in coaching, youth football
ai_summary: Qualitative study of 19 German elite youth football coaches using Technology Acceptance Model reveals that while coaches recognize mobile device utility for performance monitoring and player development, adoption remains constrained by traditional norms, resource limitations, and social expectations.

title: Association Between Expected Goals (xG) and Goal Scoring Across Club and National Team Competitions in Elite Football
abstract: The purpose of the study: The purpose of this study was to analyze the association between xG and goals scored in soccer matches. Materials and methods: This study was quantitative, correlational, and longitudinal. 333 league matches were analyzed. The dataset was obtained from Sofascore, a website
sub_theme: expected goals (xG)
ai_summary: Expected goals (xG) shows positive correlation with actual goals in elite football across club and national team competitions, with stronger associations in club tournaments (r=0.537 in Copa Libertadores) than national teams due to better tactical continuity.

title: Investigating Qualification and Professional Career Pathways of Women Coaches in High-Performance Sports: A Mixed Method Study Protocol
abstract: High-performance coaching is a deeply gendered field of work. Despite international and national efforts, women are still systematically underrepresented in coach education and in leadership positions. For example, at the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo, only 13% of the accredited coaches were women. Wh
sub_theme: women coaches' qualification and career pathways in high-performance sport
ai_summary: Mixed-methods study protocol (QualiFT) investigating gender-specific barriers and support factors for women high-performance coaches in Germany using surveys, biographical interviews, and focus groups to identify structural and individual obstacles to coaching equity (only 13% female accredited coaches at 2020 Olympics).

title: Validation of a Markerless Multi-Camera Pipeline for Bouldering Fall Kinematics
abstract: Indoor bouldering is a popular and rapidly growing sport in which climbers fall repeatedly from walls up to 4–5 m high, making lower-limb injuries common. It is therefore essential to understand fall kinematics and impact conditions, yet fall kinematics remain poorly documented because laboratory mo
sub_theme: fall kinematics, bouldering, markerless motion capture
ai_summary: A validated markerless multi-camera pipeline (Pose2Sim) accurately measured fall kinematics and typology in indoor bouldering for teenage athletes, though IMUs remained necessary to quantify impact acceleration intensity.

title: Relationship between time from onset of lower back pain to medical examination and recurrence and stage of disease in lumbar spondylolysis
journal: Journal of Back and Musculoskeletal Rehabilitation
abstract: Background Lumbar spondylolysis, a stress fracture, is frequently observed in adolescent athletes performing repetitive spinal extension and rotation. Early diagnosis and treatment are crucial to prevent progression and recurrence. However, the impact of the time from symptom onset to consultation o
sub_theme: lumbar spondylolysis, consultation delay, disease stage
ai_summary: In 83 adolescent athletes with lumbar spondylolysis, disease stage was the only independent predictor of recurrence; delayed consultation (>30 days) indirectly increased recurrence risk by advancing disease stage at diagnosis, highlighting the importance of early medical evaluation.

title: Increased contralateral dynamic valgus in female athletes following ACL reconstruction
abstract: Abstract Purpose Female athletes have a higher risk of anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury, which has been associated with neuromuscular deficits and dynamic valgus, while contralateral risk profiles after ACL reconstruction remain insufficiently characterized. The purpose of this study was to i
sub_theme: ACL reconstruction, dynamic valgus, sex-specific risk
ai_summary: Female athletes exhibited significantly greater contralateral dynamic valgus during drop jump landings following ACL reconstruction compared to males (−2.9° valgus vs. 6.7° varus, p=0.016), suggesting sex-specific neuromuscular risk patterns requiring individualized rehabilitation.

title: Applied performance ecology: Testing strategies of talent identification in sports using ecological systems
abstract: Predicting success is a common goal for ecologists and sports scientists, yet these disciplines rarely interact. Sports scientists often use tests of closed-skill or game performances, but these are often critiqued for their inherent uncertainties in predicting success. In contrast, ecologists embra
sub_theme: talent identification, ecological systems, probabilistic prediction, crayfish contests
ai_summary: An ecological systems approach using crayfish territorial contests demonstrates that talent identification efficiency improves when combining individual trait measurements with contest outcomes over multiple rounds, offering a probabilistic framework applicable to youth sports selection.

title: Return to play and recurrent instability rates in open versus arthroscopic anterior shoulder stabilisation in the contact and collision athlete: A systematic review
abstract: Abstract Purpose The purpose of this systematic review is to compare return‐to‐play and recurrence rates in collision and contact athletes who undergo open or arthroscopic Bankart repair. Methods The literature search was performed based on the preferred reporting items for systematic reviews and me
sub_theme: anterior shoulder instability, return-to-play
ai_summary: Systematic review and meta-analysis of 319 contact/collision athletes shows open Bankart repair has significantly lower recurrence rates (7.2% vs 17.9%) than arthroscopic repair, with similar return-to-play rates (~92%).

title: АНТИДОПІНГОВА ОСВІТА У СПОРТІ: ОЦІНКА СТАНУ ТА ПЕРСПЕКТИВ РОЗВИТКУ В УКРАЇНІ (ЗА РЕЗУЛЬТАТАМИ ОПИТУВАННЯ ТРЕНЕРІВ)
journal: Physical Culture and Sport Scientific Perspective
abstract: Education is regarded as a fundamental tool for preventing anti-doping rule violations and as a strategic direction in developing a culture of integrity in sport. Considering the updated requirements of the World Anti-Doping Code and the provisions of the International Standard for Education (ISE),
sub_theme: anti-doping education in Ukrainian sports
ai_summary: A survey of 131 coaches across 46 sports in Ukraine revealed that coaches recognize their central role in anti-doping education and prefer interactive, practice-oriented learning formats over digital tools for building athlete integrity culture.

title: Martial arts striking sports prehabilitation programme (MASS-12): Jump higher, move safer, and feel better
abstract: Background Martial arts involve cutting, jumping and landing movements known to increase injury risk. Martial artists frequently sustain injuries. Recreational martial arts have yet to implement an evidence-informed prehabilitation programme to prevent these injuries. Here, we evaluate the Martial A
sub_theme: prehabilitation, lower limb injury prevention, martial arts
ai_summary: The MASS-12 prehabilitation programme for recreational martial artists (Jiu Jitsu) significantly improved frontal plane projection angle (−11.9° to −1.93°) and single leg vertical hop performance (25.2 to 27.5 cm), demonstrating easy implementation and athlete acceptance.

title: Sport-Related Concussion in Youth and Adult Athletes: A Narrative Review of Long-Term Outcomes and Prevention
abstract: Sport-related concussion (SRC) is a common form of mild traumatic brain injury and represents a growing public health concern across youth, adolescent, and adult athletic populations. Characterized by transient neurological dysfunction following biomechanical forces to the head or body, SRC presents
sub_theme: sport-related concussion epidemiology, long-term outcomes, prevention
ai_summary: Narrative review of sport-related concussion evidence demonstrates higher vulnerability in youth athletes, identifies prior concussion as major risk factor, and recommends multifaceted prevention including equipment standards, rule modifications, and neuromuscular training.

title: Anthropometric Determinants of Rowing Performance in a Multinational Youth Cohort
journal: Journal of Functional Morphology and Kinesiology
abstract: Background: Rowing performance in youth athletes is strongly influenced by anthropometric characteristics, body composition, and limb proportions; however, the combined contribution of these factors across developmental stages remains insufficiently understood. This study investigated the relationsh
sub_theme: anthropometric talent identification, youth cohort
ai_summary: Rowing performance in a multinational youth cohort of 194 athletes was strongly determined by body surface area (r=0.739), relative muscle mass (r=0.531), and segmental body dimensions, with benchmark values of ~1.90 m² BSA and ~40% relative muscle mass identifying higher-performing athletes.

title: Prevalence and risk factors of stress urinary incontinence among female horseback riders in Poland
abstract: Stress urinary incontinence (SUI) is usually associated with aging and parity, but repetitive intra-abdominal pressure during physical activity can also trigger its onset in young women. Horseback riding, despite potential benefits for pelvic floor strengthening, may also contribute to pelvic floor
sub_theme: stress urinary incontinence, pelvic floor, horseback riding
ai_summary: Among 100 Polish female horseback riders, 36% reported stress urinary incontinence with significantly impaired quality of life; age and BMI were independent risk factors, while longer training experience correlated with lower symptom distress.

title: Rehabilitation and return to activity after platelet‐rich plasma injections in chronic tendinopathies: Consensus from international experts
abstract: Abstract Background The effectiveness of platelet‐rich plasma (PRP) injections in chronic tendinopathies remains debated. Although the product's characteristics play a role, the impact of postinjection recommendations remains poorly investigated. Objective To establish principles and guidelines for
sub_theme: platelet-rich plasma injection rehabilitation protocols
ai_summary: Delphi consensus methodology established 10 evidence-based recommendations for post-PRP injection rehabilitation and return-to-activity timelines in chronic tendinopathies across multiple sports.

title: PENERAPAN ALGORITMA BRANCH AND BOUND DENGAN STATISTIK EXPECTED GOALS UNTUK MENENTUKAN KOMBINASI PASSING OPTIMAL DALAM SEPAK BOLA
abstract: This study proposes a new approach in football tactical analysis by utilizing Branch and Bound (B&B) algorithm and Expected Goals (xG) statistics to determine the optimal passing combination that maximizes goal-scoring chances. By modeling the game as a decision tree, each node represents a game
sub_theme: optimal passing combinations, expected goals
ai_summary: Study proposes Branch and Bound algorithm combined with Expected Goals statistics to identify optimal passing combinations in football that maximize goal-scoring chances.

title: Core–Periphery Dynamics in Hungarian Handball: Regional Disparities and Gendered Patterns
abstract: This study examines the spatial structure of adult men’s and women’s handball championships in Hungary during the 2024/2025 season, focusing on regional disparities and gendered patterns. Based on data from 184 teams across three national divisions (NB I, NB I/B, NB II), the research applies a weigh
sub_theme: spatial inequalities and gendered patterns in handball
ai_summary: Analysis of Hungarian handball championships (184 teams across divisions) using ANOVA and Moran's I spatial analysis reveals significant regional disparities with stronger spatial concentration in women's leagues, correlating with socioeconomic development and highlighting need for integrated sport and regional development strategies.

title: Mathematical model to support the identification of young football players with sufficient physical fitness to join professional women's teams
journal: International Journal of Sports Science & Coaching
abstract: The recent growth of women's football in Brazil, alongside the expansion of professional competitions, has increased the demand for young players to join elite teams. This scenario raises important questions about players’ physical readiness and the tools required to identify those capable of meetin
sub_theme: talent identification, physical fitness criteria, youth to professional transition
ai_summary: Discriminant function analysis model using countermovement jump, 20-m sprint, change of direction, and Yo-Yo Intermittent Recovery test identified that only 26.1% of youth female football players in Brazil met the physical profile of professional players, with change of direction showing strongest predictive value (r=-0.855).

title: Cross-Sectional Associations of Sport Participation, Academic Performance, and Psychological Well-Being Among Rural Romanian Adolescent Boys in the Context of Family Background
abstract: Background: Adolescence is a sensitive period for psychological, academic, and social development, and sports participation has been described as a potential protective factor for academic performance and psychological well-being. However, limited research has examined the combined influence of spor
sub_theme: academic performance, psychological well-being, socioeconomic factors
ai_summary: Among rural Romanian adolescent boys aged 11-14, football and judo players demonstrated significantly higher academic achievement and life satisfaction than non-athletes, though athletes also showed slightly elevated depressive symptoms, with family socioeconomic background playing a moderating role.

title: Comparing the Efficacy of Professional Athlete-Led Online Instruction and Traditional Coaching for Developing Technical Competencies in Novice Sepak Takraw Players: A 12-Week Randomised Controlled Study
abstract: Background and purposeThis study aimed to compare the efficacy of professional athlete-led online instruction with traditional in-person coaching for developing technical competencies in novice sepak takraw players, addressing critical knowledge gaps in digital sports instruction and motor skill dev
sub_theme: online coaching, technical skill development, sepak takraw
ai_summary: Professional athlete-led online instruction proved significantly more effective than traditional in-person coaching for developing technical skills in novice sepak takraw players aged 14-17, with service accuracy improving 38.67 points versus 16.76 points in the control group.

title: Characteristics of goal situations when using tactical models in the training process of football players
abstract: Background and purpose To select recommendations for creating goal situations and increasing the effectiveness of interaction between players during attacking actions, it is necessary to develop and experimentally implement various variants of tactical models of team play into the training process o
sub_theme: tactical models, goal situations, team play interactions, training effectiveness
ai_summary: A 12-month experimental study with 22 university football players found that implementing tactical models during training significantly increased goal situations arising from player interactions in midfield/flanks and from forward/midfielder actions, particularly in minutes 61–90 of matches.

title: Hierarchical deep reinforcement learning for real-time tactical decision-making in team sports
abstract: Purpose The purpose of this paper is to propose a hierarchical deep reinforcement learning (H-DRL) framework for real-time tactical decision-making in team sports. The framework addresses challenges such as continuous action spaces, partial observability and adversarial environments by leveraging mu
sub_theme: hierarchical deep reinforcement learning, real-time decision-making, explainable AI
ai_summary: A hierarchical deep reinforcement learning framework using graph neural networks and transformers for tactical decision-making in basketball, soccer, and rugby achieved 34.7% higher tactical accuracy and identified 17 novel tactical patterns, improving youth team performance by 42.3%.

title: PHYSIOLOGICAL CHARACTERISTICS IN SUCCESSFUL FEMALE SINGLE FIGURE SKATING ATHLETES
abstract: The actual problem, we are trying to reveal in our study, – the identification of physiological characteristics allowing, to carry out earlier allocation of successful in competitions figure skaters – singles. We are trying to reveal in our study is the identification of physiological characteristic
sub_theme: talent identification, physiological profiling
ai_summary: Physiological and psychophysiological testing of 30 female figure skaters identified characteristics differentiating successful from less successful competitors, supporting early talent allocation for women's national teams.

title: Development of team-based and individualised speed zone thresholds for elite club-level women’s soccer
abstract: Speed zone thresholds in women's soccer are often based on thresholds derived from the men's game. This study applied a data-mining approach to generate (a) team-based speed zone thresholds, and (b) individualised speed zone thresholds for elite female soccer players. Activity data from 47 elite clu
sub_theme: speed zone thresholds via clustering
ai_summary: Data-mining approach using spectral clustering on GPS data from 47 elite female soccer players generated team-based (1.12, 2.83, 5.10 m·s⁻¹) and individualized speed zone thresholds that better capture women's soccer demands than existing male-derived standards.

title: Establishing Normative Data for Single- and Dual-Task Tandem Gait in Healthy Interuniversity Male and Female Athletes
abstract: Objective: Single- and dual-task tandem gait are key components of the Sport Concussion Assessment Tool 6 and Sport Concussion Office Assessment Tool 6 (SCOAT6) balance assessment. However, the performance criteria for tandem gait remain unclear for male and female healthy athletes, and those with a
sub_theme: gender differences in concussion assessment, normative data
ai_summary: Study of 103 interuniversity athletes established that healthy female athletes performed single- and dual-task tandem gait significantly slower than males (1.6-2.8 seconds difference), with most athletes performing below SCOAT6 'normal' criteria, suggesting need for gender-specific normative values.

title: Return to High-Speed Running After a Hamstring Injury in Soccer: A Scoping Review About Criteria and Management of On-Field Rehabilitation
abstract: ABSTRACT The importance of criteria for rehabilitation progression in hamstring injuries is well-known, particularly regarding the return to high-speed running (HSR). No previous reviews have compiled the existing evidence on HSR progression criteria or the protocols used to manage the on-field expo
sub_theme: hamstring injury, return to high-speed running, rehabilitation progression
ai_summary: Scoping review of criteria and on-field rehabilitation protocols for progression to high-speed running in soccer players recovering from hamstring injuries.

title: Kinematic variables influencing somersault turn time in medley swimmers using artificial neural networks (ANN)
abstract: Introduction: Efficient performance in swimming turns is a critical component of competitive success, especially in sprint and middle distance events where turn execution can significantly affect race outcomes. Objective: Turn Time in Medley Swimmers Using Artificial Neural Networks (ANN), Examine s
sub_theme: somersault turn technique optimization
ai_summary: Artificial neural networks applied to kinematic data from youth medley swimmers identify that somersault turn performance is governed by complex nonlinear interactions among lower-limb joint angles, trunk positioning, and propulsion variables rather than single biomechanical factors.

title: Post-activation potentiation enhancement induction strategies with different rest intervals on jump performance: a meta-analysis
abstract: Objective This meta-analysis aimed to systematically evaluate the effects of post-activation potentiation enhancement (PAPE) on jump performance and explore its optimal induction strategies. Methods Randomized controlled trials (RCTs) investigating the influence of PAPE training on jump performance
sub_theme: post-activation potentiation, jump performance, rest intervals
ai_summary: Meta-analysis of 22 RCTs (468 participants) demonstrates post-activation potentiation significantly enhances jump performance, with optimal effects using back squats, moderate intensity, and 3-7 minute rest intervals.

title: A087: Assessment of Table Tennis Stroke Effectiveness using the Artificial Intelligence Technology-Based Algorithm
abstract: Using Artificial intelligence to assist sports training is a hallmark of the information age. Table tennis, a popular sport in China and worldwide, can also benefit from the latest technological advancements in learning and training. Objective: This study aims to quantitatively evaluate the effectiv
sub_theme: forehand stroke kinematics, dynamic time-warping
ai_summary: Dynamic time-warping AI algorithm successfully distinguished table tennis stroke effectiveness between beginner and intermediate players by analyzing elbow angle differences in forehand strokes, with DTW values showing large effect sizes (Cohen's d=0.86).

title: A153: Rehabilitation Research on Patellofemoral Pain Syndrome (PFPS) in Female Judo Athletes
abstract: Patellofemoral pain syndrome (PFPS) is a prevalent knee disorder among athletes, known for its high incidence rate and propensity to progress into chronic conditions. Female athletes are more vulnerable due to inherent hip-knee muscle imbalances and aberrant movement patterns. Unfortunately, dedicat
sub_theme: patellofemoral pain syndrome, core stability rehabilitation
ai_summary: Six-week core and functional training program significantly improved Lysholm and IKDC scores and corrected hip-knee muscle imbalances in female judo athletes with patellofemoral pain syndrome, compared to controls.

title: A130: Comparative Analysis of Aerobic Capacity in Female College Golfers of Different Levels
abstract: A professional golf tournament typically consists of four rounds, with each round lasting at least 3.5 hours. During the competition, golfers are required to adhere to the principle of “walking briskly and playing steadily” to complete the entire tournament. Adequate physical fitness and good aerobi
sub_theme: aerobic capacity, VO2max
ai_summary: Female college golfers at higher skill levels (N1 group) demonstrated more efficient aerobic capacity with higher VO₂/kg, lower energy expenditure, and better ventilatory efficiency during treadmill testing compared to general-level golfers.

title: A128: Correlation Between Balance Ability and Stroke Effectiveness in Female Golfers
abstract: To investigate the effects of balance ability differences on the Stroke Effectiveness of female golfers. Eight excellent female golfers (Group A National first-class athletes and Group B Grade National second-level athletes) were selected, and the FlightScope Xi radar data acquisition detector was u
sub_theme: balance ability, stroke effectiveness
ai_summary: Balance ability tests revealed that dynamic balance (particularly D1 and D10 conditions) was positively correlated with driver stroke effectiveness (Smash distance) in female golfers, with national first-class athletes showing superior stability.

title: A061: Analysis of the Current Situation of Table Tennis Players' Burnout
abstract: Burnout is a significant issue among athletes, especially those undergoing high-intensity training and facing competitive pressures. Table tennis players, due to the demands of their sport, are particularly vulnerable. Burnout can impair performance, mental health, and lead to training interruptions
sub_theme: athlete burnout
ai_summary: Survey of table tennis players using the Athlete Burnout Questionnaire found that older players and those with longer training durations exhibited significantly higher burnout levels, while gender and sports grade showed no significant differences.

title: A018: Impact of Unanticipated and Backhand Area Smash Landing on Female Badminton Players’ Lower Limb Biomechanics
abstract: In badminton, lower limb injuries frequently occur during unanticipated smash landing movements. Additionally, the risk of lower limb injuries may vary depending on different landing strategies. This study aims to investigate the impact of unanticipated factors and two types of smash actions in the
sub_theme: lower limb kinematics, landing mechanics, injury risk
ai_summary: Motion capture analysis of female badminton players revealed that unanticipated backhand smash landings produced higher knee extension moments and vertical load rates, with movement type (rear vs. lateral) significantly affecting frontal plane biomechanics and injury risk.

title: A207: AI Era and Sports Equity: A Sociological Perspective
abstract: This study explores the impact of artificial intelligence (AI) on sports equity and inclusion, focusing on its use in training, officiating, and talent selection. AI includes technologies like AI-driven training tools and systems, such as VAR. While AI can enhance access to sports resources, it may
sub_theme: AI bias, equity, inclusion, talent selection
ai_summary: Qualitative study found that while AI-driven training improves accessibility, AI in officiating and talent selection raises fairness concerns, with evidence that AI metrics favor well-funded programs and male performance data, potentially overlooking diverse female talents.

title: A231: Effects of a Six-Week Pre-Competition Program on Blood Biomarkers in Female Adolescent Rowers
abstract: Rowing is a high-intensity cyclic endurance sport that demands precise regulation of training loads to optimize performance. Adolescent athletes undergoing rapid growth and endocrine changes may respond differently to training than adults. However, most current research focuses on adult rowers, with
sub_theme: blood biomarkers, training adaptation
ai_summary: Six-week pre-competition training in adolescent female rowers produced beneficial hematological adaptations (increased RBC and MCV) and favorable endocrine changes (increased testosterone and T/C ratio), indicating positive training-induced physiological responses.

title: A186: Evaluating Badminton-Specific Court Testing: A Systematic Review
abstract: Badminton, a technically and tactically demanding sport, requires rapid reaction, eye-hand coordination, and agility, alongside both aerobic and anaerobic energy system capabilities. However, current mainstream fitness assessments primarily rely on non-specific and semi-specific tests, which, while
sub_theme: badminton-specific fitness testing, field tests
ai_summary: Systematic review of 15 studies evaluating badminton-specific court tests found 13 of 15 tests (7 endurance, 8 agility) demonstrated high reliability and validity for assessing sport-specific movement demands, though questions remain on ecological validity of current assessments.

title: Caffeine ingestion before exercise improves prolonged intermittent-sprint performance of team-sport athletes in normobaric hypoxia
abstract: Purpose To investigate whether caffeine ingestion before exercise enhances performance during a prolonged intermittent-sprint test (IST) under hypoxic conditions simulating team-sport activity. Methods In a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled crossover design, fifteen (five females) team-sp
sub_theme: caffeine supplementation, hypoxic performance
ai_summary: Caffeine ingestion at 6 mg/kg significantly improved prolonged intermittent-sprint performance in team-sport athletes under normobaric hypoxia, increasing total work done by 5-6% across both halves of the test.

title: Prevalence of exercise-induced bronchoconstriction in elite Chinese summer sport athletes
abstract:
ABSTRACT
Background: Exercise-induced bronchoconstriction (EIB) is a prevalent respiratory condition among summer sport elite athletes, yet epidemiological data from Asian populations remain scarce. The objective of this study was to investigate the prevalence, sport-specific patterns, and physi
sub_theme: exercise-induced bronchoconstriction, sport-specific prevalence
ai_summary: Exercise-induced bronchoconstriction prevalence in 500 Chinese elite summer sport athletes was 27.6%, highest in swimming (51.52%) and lowest in wrestling (6.45%), with female athletes showing higher prevalence than males (31.1% vs. 23.7%).

title: Influence of Motor Abilities on Throwing Performance Across Motor Learning Stages in Physically Active Female Athletes
abstract: Purpose: The aim of this study was to determine the influence of different motor abilities on performance in shot put, discus,and javelin among women, as well as the changes in their importance across different stages of motor learning.Methods: Participants were 21 female athletes (age 20.4 ± 1.2 ye
sub_theme: motor abilities, throwing technique, learning stages
ai_summary: In female track and field athletes learning shot put, discus, and javelin, upper-body explosive strength was the primary predictor of performance, with its effect strengthening across motor learning stages while maximal strength became significant only in final stages.

title: Variances in Power Output of Female Athletes During the Menstrual Phases
abstract: The purpose of this research was to examine if there are any variances in a female athlete’s ability to produce power, that could be correlated with the menstrual cycle phases. The study observed three elite female athletes throughout 13 weeks, collecting relative propulsive power and relative braki
sub_theme: menstrual cycle, power output, female athletes
ai_summary: Analysis of three elite female athletes across 13 weeks found trends of small declines in propulsive and braking power during the luteal phase of the menstrual cycle, though differences were not statistically significant.

title: A187: The Comprehensive Impact of Competitive Liondance on Bio-Psycho-Social Health: Cohort Tracking Study of Elite Athletes
abstract: Competitive lion dance, a traditional sport that integrates artistic performance, cultural heritage, and high-intensity physical training, has not yet been systematically studied for its multidimensional health benefits. Method: This study investigates the comprehensive impact of competitive lion da
sub_theme: competitive lion dance, bio-psycho-social health
ai_summary: In 32 elite competitive lion dance athletes tracked over 12 months, VO₂max increased 12.3%, lower limb explosive power improved 18.7%, anxiety/depression decreased 26.5%-21.8%, and team cohesion improved 40.6%.

title: Efectos del entrenamiento excéntrico vs entrenamiento neuromuscular sobre la prevención de lesiones en jugadores de fútbol: una revisión sistemática
abstract: Introduction. The high level of competition in soccer and its increasing number of games per season contribute to a high prevalence of injuries in the sport. Therefore, this systematic review aimed to determine the effects of neuromuscular training versus eccentric training on muscle injuries in soc
sub_theme: eccentric training, neuromuscular training, hamstring and knee injuries
ai_summary: Systematic review of 21 randomized controlled trials found that both eccentric and neuromuscular training effectively reduce muscle injury incidence in soccer players, with eccentric exercises particularly effective for hamstring injuries and neuromuscular training for knee injuries.

title: A243: The Relationship Among Sport Confidence, Failure Coping, and Athletic Motivation of Students in Physical Education
abstract: In the research on the psychological abilities in sports competitions, exploring sports motivation is indispensable. Sports motivation has the functions of stimulating students' sports behaviors, guiding students to choose sports events, and strengthening and maintaining students' participation in s
sub_theme: sport confidence, failure coping, athletic motivation
ai_summary: Survey of 897 physical education undergraduate students revealed significant positive correlations between trait and state sport confidence (r=0.409), among failure coping dimensions (r=0.255-0.401), and between participation and avoidance motivation tendencies (r=0.329).

title: A246: Epidemiological Characteristics of Injury Among Chinese Rowing Athletes
abstract: To develop a prevention program for rowing-related injuries, it is crucial to study the epidemiological characteristics of injury among Chinese rowing athletes. This study aimed to investigate the distribution and incidence of injuries among Chinese rowing athletes aged 12-24. A cross-sectional stud
sub_theme: injury incidence, sport-specific risk factors
ai_summary: Cross-sectional study of 207 Chinese rowing athletes found overall injury prevalence of 38.2% (55.0% in females), with lower back injuries most common (39.7%), and female athletes over 18 years showing the highest injury rates per 1000 training sessions (7.85).

title: A263: Exploring CADD-Based Binding Modes of Androstenedione and Its Metabolites with Potential in vivo Targets
abstract: The abuse of androstenedione, an endogenous steroid hormone, among athletes to enhance performance is a significant concern in sports. Current anti-doping detection methods are limited by short detection windows and high false-positive rates, largely due to the transient nature of primary metabolite
sub_theme: anti-doping detection, steroid metabolism
ai_summary: Molecular docking simulations identify stable androstenedione metabolites as potential long-term biomarkers to extend anti-doping detection windows in athletes.

title: A nutritional intervention within highly trained youth soccer players using a COM-B model of behaviour change: A case series approach
journal: International Journal of Sports Science & Coaching
abstract: Large inter-individual variability in daily energy and carbohydrate intake has been reported in highly-trained academy soccer players, potentially impacting training and match day performance, recovery and physical development. Nutritional interventions in these cohorts typically rely on group educa
sub_theme: dietary behavior change, youth academy players, COM-B model
ai_summary: Case series of three elite youth academy soccer players using COM-B behavior change model demonstrates that theory-driven individualized dietary interventions significantly improve energy (19–55% increase) and carbohydrate intake alongside fat-free mass gains.

title: A149: Research on the Application of Artificial Intelligence in Football
abstract: With the development of artificial intelligence technology in the sports field, the role of sports data information is becoming increasingly significant. Specifically, in the application of football, artificial intelligence technology is used to scientifically mine data from human sports activities,
sub_theme: artificial intelligence applications, data mining, injury prevention, performance analysis
ai_summary: A narrative review and interview-based study examining artificial intelligence applications in football identifies advances in data collection types, analytical capacity, real-time processing, and accuracy, demonstrating improvements in injury prevention, training planning, and performance analysis.

title: Fasciculoventricular Pathway in a Young Athlete—A Case Report
abstract: Background: Fasciculoventricular pathways (FVPs) are an uncommon cause of pre-excitation that can be mistaken for other more common accessory pathways in clinical practice. This case report highlights the key features of FVPs and their management. Case Summary: A 12-year-old male athlete was referre
sub_theme: fasciculoventricular pathway, pre-excitation, return to play
ai_summary: Case report of a 12-year-old male athlete with asymptomatic fasciculoventricular pathway showing sustained pre-excitation during exercise stress testing, managed conservatively with return to play authorization.

title: Sudden Cardiac Arrest in Athletes
abstract: The incidence of sudden cardiac arrest in athletes varies according to age, race and ethnic group, sex, sport, and social determinants of health. The common causes of sudden cardiac arrest include cardiomyopathies, electrical disorders, coronary-artery anomalies, and other cardiac structural abnorma
sub_theme: sudden cardiac arrest, cardiovascular screening, return to play
ai_summary: Narrative review of sudden cardiac arrest in athletes covering incidence, causes, screening, emergency management, and return-to-play decision-making across sports.

title: A171: An Applied Study of Smart Sports to Enable Youth Soccer Training
abstract: Smart sports technology can improve the technical and tactical level of youth soccer players through a new generation of information technology, combined with the laws of physical and mental development of young people, and through systematic and scientific training methods. This study verifies the
sub_theme: smart sports technology, youth training, real-time monitoring
ai_summary: An 8-week intervention using smart sports technology (GPS, heart rate monitoring, AI-driven feedback) on 40 youth soccer players (ages 12-16) improved training effectiveness, motivation, and technical/tactical performance while ensuring sports safety through real-time physiological monitoring.

title: A063: Research on the Load Characteristics of Female College Volleyball Players in Consecutive Matches
abstract: This study aims to analyze and compare data such as total movement load, movement load at different speed zones, physical load, jumps, and heart rate obtained from female college volleyball players during consecutive matches. The goal is to explore the load characteristics and patterns of the Chines
sub_theme: load characteristics, consecutive matches, fatigue
ai_summary: Analysis of 12 female college volleyball players across 4 consecutive matches using IMU and heart rate monitoring revealed that total movement load initially decreased then increased, with high-intensity loads (>1.5g) averaging 61.8±14.8 units per match.

title: Exploring shared experiences as citizen sport diplomats: a collaborative self-ethnography
abstract: Research purpose: This study was a critical analysis of the lived experiences of three American university professors who served as volunteer citizen diplomats in a bi-lateral U.S. State Department sport exchange program with North Macedonian volleyball coaches. Research methods: With the aim of cap
sub_theme: sport diplomacy, collaborative self-ethnography
ai_summary: Collaborative self-ethnography of three American university professors serving as citizen sport diplomats in U.S.-North Macedonian volleyball exchange reveals four themes of transformational learning.

title: Back Squat Post-Activation Performance Enhancement on Parameters of a 3-Min All-Out Running Test: A Complex Network Analysis Perspective
abstract: This study investigated the impact of post-activation performance enhancement (PAPE) on the parameters of the 3 min all-out test (3MT) in non-motorized tethered running, applying the concept of complex networks for integrative analysis. Ten recreational runners underwent anthropometric assessments,
sub_theme: post-activation performance enhancement, complex networks
ai_summary: Back squat post-activation performance enhancement significantly improved end power and running economy in recreational runners, with complex network analysis revealing altered configurations in aerobic efficiency parameters.

title: Team trust in professional women's cycling teams
journal: International Journal of Sports Science & Coaching
abstract: The purpose of this study was to explore professional female cyclists’ understanding and experience of team trust in road cycling, with a focus on the factors that contribute to the development and maintenance of trust, and furthermore the consequences of team trust for the team. Based on a qualitat
sub_theme: team trust and collaboration in professional women's cycling
ai_summary: A qualitative study of 10 professional female road cyclists found team trust to be a multidimensional phenomenon shaped by individual attributes and structural team factors, generating positive outcomes for interpersonal relationships and overall performance.

title: Application of the Ballroom Aerobic Test protocol for assessing performance in standard-style dancesport athletes
abstract: Background Although the existing field-based tests to assess functional capacity in dancesport have been developed, most of them have been applied to ballet or contemporary dancesport athletes at the individual level, while little evidence is available for dancesport couples in standard dance discip
sub_theme: aerobic performance testing, dancesport couples, reliability
ai_summary: A test-retest reliability study of the Ballroom Aerobic Test (BAT) protocol with 13 standard-style dancesport athletes (6 pairs and 1 individual) found very good to excellent reliability (ICC=0.80–0.99, CV=1.63–4.85%) for assessing aerobic performance across five standard dance disciplines with progressive metabolic and ventilatory measurement.

title: Relationships Between Hematological Variables and Bone Metabolism in Elite Female Trail Runners
abstract: Background: This study investigated the relationships between hematological and bone metabolism variables in 35 elite female trail runners, focusing on identifying key hematological correlates of bone health. Methods: Forty-four hematological variables, including biochemical, hormonal, metabolic, li
sub_theme: bone metabolism, hematological variables, female endurance athletes
ai_summary: A cross-sectional analysis of 35 elite female trail runners identified moderate associations between hematological variables and bone health, with magnesium negatively associated with lumbar spine and whole-body bone mineral content/density (suggesting mineral mobilization under chronic training stress), and follicle-stimulating hormone and thyroid hormones showing positive/site-specific skeletal associations.

title: Where Sex Matters for Perioperative and Postoperative Anterior Cruciate Ligament Reconstruction Outcomes: A Systematic Review of MOON Literature
journal: The American Journal of Sports Medicine
abstract: Background: Females are 2 to 8 times more likely than males to sustain an initial anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) tear. However, after ACL reconstruction (ACLR), it remains less certain how males and females differ in other ACLR-related outcomes. Purpose: To summarize Multicenter Orthopaedic Outcom
sub_theme: sex differences in ACL reconstruction outcomes
ai_summary: Systematic review of MOON studies showing females have worse Marx activity scores and return-to-play percentages at 2, 6, and 10 years post-ACLR, but equivalent graft tear rates compared to males.

title: Assessing criterion validity and test-retest reliability of a computer vision-based system for tracking player location in cricket
journal: International Journal of Sports Science & Coaching
abstract: Player tracking is widely utilised to quantify physical and tactical performance of elite athletes, with wearable technologies being the most commonly used systems. However, wearable devices are limited in their ability to capture location data of an opposing team, thereby limiting the collection of
sub_theme: player tracking systems, validity and reliability
ai_summary: A computer vision-based player tracking system for cricket demonstrated valid and reliable location measurements (RMSE 0.28–1.06m) with excellent test-retest reliability (ICC=1.00), supporting its use for tactical performance analysis.

title: Larger-volume capillary blood sampling is a valid alternative to assess progesterone and 17ß-estradiol for cycle phase identification in tactical female athletes
abstract: Introduction Serum-based hormone analysis is considered essential for determining menstrual cycle phases in sport and exercise science. However, its reliance on venous blood sampling limits applicability in field-based or operational contexts. This study evaluated the validity of larger-volume capil
sub_theme: menstrual cycle hormone assessment via capillary sampling
ai_summary: Study of 12 female soldiers validates earlobe capillary blood sampling as alternative to venous sampling for progesterone and estradiol quantification across menstrual cycle, with concordance correlation coefficients >0.91 for both hormones.

title: From Violation to Stigma: A Literature Review of Athletes' Lived Experiences Following Anti-Doping Sanctions
abstract: Despite its protective intent, the anti-doping system functions in a complex, high-stakes environment where strict liability and public scrutiny can produce unintended harms for sanctioned athletes. To date, limited insights exist into the lived experiences of individuals sanctioned for Anti-Doping
sub_theme: anti-doping sanctions, lived experiences, athlete mental health
ai_summary: A narrative literature review of 12 empirical studies examining the psychological, social, and career impacts of anti-doping rule violation sanctions on athletes across multiple sports, identifying five key areas of concern including emotional distress, social isolation, procedural injustice, career disruption, and identity loss.

title: Ashwagandha Root Extract Stabilises Physiological Stress Responses in Male and Female Team Sports Athletes During Pre-Season Training
abstract: Objectives: This study investigates the effects of 600 mg/day Ashwagandha root extract on physiological stress biomarkers, perception of recovery, muscle strength and aerobic capacity in team sports athletes during pre-season training, a period associated with elevated cortisol and accumulated train
sub_theme: Ashwagandha supplementation, stress biomarkers, pre-season training
ai_summary: A randomized controlled trial of 56 rugby, water polo, and football athletes (14 females, 14 males per group) found that 600 mg/day Ashwagandha root extract for 42 days stabilized salivary cortisol/cortisone, improved recovery perception and muscle strength in female athletes, and enhanced jump performance in male athletes during pre-season training.

title: Relationships Between Depression and Body Composition in Collegiate Athletes and Non-athletes
abstract: Up to 62.9% of the general college student population report depression. Whether or not collegiate athletes have higher or lower depression scores remains unclear. PURPOSE: To 1) determine the incidence of depression at a midwestern university and 2) explore relationships between depression and body
sub_theme: depression screening, body composition, collegiate athletes
ai_summary: A cross-sectional study of 415 NCAA Division II students (290 males) across 12 sports found that male non-athletes had significantly higher depression scores (11.8±10.0) than male athletes (mean 5.3±6.7), with tennis players showing the lowest scores (2.1±4.0).

title: Effect of live‐high, train‐low strategy induced by chronic low‐dose carbon monoxide exposure on haematological parameters and performance in trained individuals
