sub_theme: women's participation in sport and physical activity
ai_summary: Intersectional analysis of women's participation in sport and physical activity in Saudi Arabia, examining socio-cultural barriers and opportunities.

title: Análisis del lenguaje inclusivo en la prensa deportiva en España desde una óptica de género: los Juegos Olímpicos de París
abstract: Introduction: This article explores the persistent challenges of non-inclusive language and gender stereotypes in sports press coverage in Spain during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games.Despite notable advancements in gender equality and the growing prominence of women in sports, media outlets persist in
sub_theme: media coverage and inclusive language in sports journalism
ai_summary: Mixed-methods analysis of 76 Spanish sports newspaper front pages during Paris 2024 Olympics reveals stereotypical language and underrepresentation of female athletes compared to male counterparts.

title: Doping Detection through Haematological Parameters and D-dimer Levels amongst Athletes and Sports Administrators in Ibadan, Southwestern Nigeria
abstract: Background: The haematology module is an important component of the Athlete Biological Passport, which is being used by World Anti-doping Agency in doping detection. This module consists of complete blood count (CBC) parameters, which are measured in a longitudinal manner and deviation from the esta
sub_theme: haematological biomarkers for doping detection
ai_summary: Cross-sectional descriptive study measuring complete blood count and D-dimer parameters in 144 Nigerian athletes using Athlete Biological Passport methods found no doping indicators but elevated D-dimer levels suggesting thrombotic status.

title: A263: Exploring CADD-Based Binding Modes of Androstenedione and Its Metabolites with Potential in vivo Targets
journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
abstract: The abuse of androstenedione, an endogenous steroid hormone, among athletes to enhance performance is a significant concern in sports. Current anti-doping detection methods are limited by short detection windows and high false-positive rates, largely due to the transient nature of primary metabolite
sub_theme: anti-doping detection, androstenedione metabolites
ai_summary: Computer-aided drug design using molecular docking simulations identifies long-acting androstenedione metabolites to extend detection windows in anti-doping tests across sports.

title: Determination of diuretics in the whey protein supplements: uncovering hidden contaminants in the sports nutrition market
abstract: The widespread use of whey protein supplements raises concerns about contamination with banned diuretics, posing health risks and the potential for inadvertent doping. In this study, a liquid–liquid extraction (LLE) procedure coupled with liquid chromatography–tandem mass spectrometry (LC–MS/MS) was
sub_theme: diuretic contamination in sports supplements
ai_summary: LC–MS/MS method detected banned diuretics (bendroflumethiazide) in 21% of 58 commercial whey protein supplements, revealing contamination risk in sports nutrition products.

title: Passing and shooting accuracy in handball among Makassar city athletes
abstract: This study discusses passing and shooting, two key skills that determine the effectiveness of attacks and goal-scoring opportunities in handball. This study aims to (1) map the level of passing and shooting accuracy in handball athletes in Makassar City, (2) compare the accuracy profiles of both. Th
sub_theme: passing and shooting accuracy
ai_summary: Descriptive analysis of passing and shooting accuracy in 20 handball athletes from Makassar City showing average passing accuracy of 78.5% and shooting accuracy of 69.2%, with recommendations for pressure training integration.

title: Leaders and Teachers in Popular Culture : An Analysis of Leadership in Film and Television
journal: KTH Publication Database DiVA (KTH Royal Institute of Technology)
abstract: Aim and research question The aim of the study is to examine how leadership and motivation are portrayed in popular cultural works with a sporting context, and to analyze these portrayals in relation to Self-Determination Theory (SDT) and Bass’s leadership theories. The study aims to contribute know
sub_theme: leadership and motivation in Coach Carter and Ted Lasso
ai_summary: Theory-driven analysis of leadership and motivation portrayals in Coach Carter and Ted Lasso using Self-Determination Theory and Bass's leadership theories, showing contrasting coaching styles from authoritarian to autonomy-supportive.

title: Artificial Intelligence–Enhanced Analytics in Sport Communication: Advancing Environmental Sustainability Through Stakeholder-Centered Strategies
abstract: This study explored how artificial intelligence (AI) –enhanced analytics encompassing predictive data analysis, automated content generation, and message personalization can advance environmental sustainability communication in sport. Using a quantitative design, data were collected from 324 sport s
sub_theme: AI-enhanced sustainability communication in sport
ai_summary: Structural equation modeling of 324 Chinese sport stakeholders examining AI-driven analytics for environmental sustainability communication, finding increasing AI adoption among digitally literate groups despite organizational inertia barriers.

title: Evaluating the Decision-Making Ability of Basketball Players Using a Virtual Reality Perceptual Assessment
abstract: An essential component of individual and team success in basketball is decision-making ability. Critically, basketball coaches require reliable and valid tools to assess this skill to aid their talent evaluation processes. To address previous challenges in examining decision-making, the current stud
sub_theme: decision-making ability, virtual reality perceptual assessment, talent evaluation
ai_summary: A laboratory study using virtual reality and two-way ANOVA showed that university basketball players demonstrated significantly greater accuracy and consistency on a perceptual decision-making task compared to non-athletes, with moderate associations to assists and box creation scores.

title: A149: Research on the Application of Artificial Intelligence in Football
journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
abstract: With the development of artificial intelligence technology in the sports field, the role of sports data information is becoming increasingly significant. Specifically, in the application of football, artificial intelligence technology is used to scientifically mine data from human sports activities,
sub_theme: artificial intelligence applications, data mining, injury prevention, performance analysis
ai_summary: A narrative review and interview-based study examining artificial intelligence applications in football identifies advances in data collection types, analytical capacity, real-time processing, and accuracy, demonstrating improvements in injury prevention, training planning, and performance analysis.

title: Talent, Capital, and the FIFA World Cup: How Participation Affects Football Players’ Market Value
abstract: ABSTRACT Objective This study contributes to human capital research in sports by exploring the valuation of high‐skilled talent. Specifically, it examines how participation in the 2018 and 2022 FIFA World Cups affected the market values of footballers, with a focus on players from the top five Europ
sub_theme: World Cup participation impact on market value
ai_summary: Hierarchical linear modeling of 675 European league players shows FIFA World Cup participation does not automatically increase market values; individual performance, social media fandom, and league affiliation drive value changes more than team success.

title: Using Cervical Spine Proprioception and Vestibular/Oculomotor Assessments to Identify Return-to-Play Clearance Prognosis After Adolescent Concussion
abstract: Context : Clinical assessments of the cervical spine and vestibular/oculomotor systems may inform return-to-play (RTP) clearance time after concussion and inform individualized concussion prognosis. Our objective was to investigate whether cervical spine and vestibular/oculomotor clinical assessment
sub_theme: concussion return-to-play clearance prediction
ai_summary: Prospective cohort study of 68 adolescents with concussion found cervical spine proprioception and vestibular/oculomotor assessments were not predictive of return-to-play clearance time in multivariable analysis.

title: The impact of therapeutic exercises and ultrasound therapy on the rehabilitation of partially injured hamstring muscles in elite football players: a randomized controlled trial
abstract: Introduction: Hamstring injuries are among the most frequent in sports, especially in high-speed activities such as football, leading to recurrent episodes, prolonged recovery, and significant time lost from competition. Conventional rehabilitation methods like eccentric exercises are effective, yet
sub_theme: hamstring strain rehabilitation with ultrasound
ai_summary: Randomized controlled trial of 150 elite football players found therapeutic ultrasound combined with exercise achieved significantly faster hamstring recovery (18.3 vs 21.7 days), greater pain reduction, and higher strength gains than exercise alone.

title: Neuromuscular Adaptations of the Rotator Cuff and Scapular Stabilizers Following TheraBand-Based Throwing Training in Symptomatic Volleyball Players with Shoulder Internal Rotation Deficit: A Randomized Controlled Trial
journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
abstract: Abstract Background: Glenohumeral Internal Rotation Deficit (GIRD) rehabilitation literature lacks comprehensive neuromuscular analysis explaining motor control mechanisms underlying elastic resistance training effectiveness. Current evidence emphasizes range of motion and pain outcomes without addr
sub_theme: glenohumeral internal rotation deficit neuromuscular rehabilitation
ai_summary: Randomized controlled trial of 64 male collegiate volleyball players with GIRD found 12-week progressive TheraBand throwing training produced 107-122% increases in rotator cuff and scapular stabilizer EMG activation with improved stability indices and pain reduction.

title: Comparative Effects of Progressive TheraBand Throwing Load Versus Conventional Stretching on Posterior Shoulder Tightness, Internal Rotation Deficit, and Tendon Load Tolerance in Volleyball Players: A Randomized Controlled Trial
journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
abstract: Abstract Background: Despite widespread clinical adoption of stretching interventions for Glenohumeral Internal Rotation Deficit (GIRD) management in overhead athletes, evidence supporting long term GIRD correction and recurrent injury prevention remains limited. Conversely, little empirical evidenc
sub_theme: posterior shoulder tightness and GIRD treatment comparison
ai_summary: Randomized controlled trial of 68 male collegiate volleyball players found progressive TheraBand throwing load superior to stretching for GIRD correction (79% vs 22% cross-body adduction ROM improvement) and reducing 12-month recurrent shoulder pain incidence.

title: A Review of Research on Throwing Biomechanics, Upper Extremity Injuries, and Treatment of Throwing Injuries in Professional Baseball and Football
abstract: Background: Throwing is a fundamental skill in many sports that requires intricate biomechanical coordination to achieve maximum performance and minimize injury. Baseball pitchers and football quarterbacks have distinct throwing motions that involve unique demands on the upper extremity, which ultim
sub_theme: throwing biomechanics and upper extremity injuries in baseball and football
ai_summary: Narrative review comparing throwing biomechanics between baseball pitchers and football quarterbacks found pitchers sustain higher rates of both elbow and shoulder injuries, with distinct biomechanical differences affecting injury prevalence and treatment approaches.

Conventional rehabilitation methods like eccentric exercises are effective, ye

ai_summary: Randomized controlled trial in 150 elite male football players shows that combining therapeutic ultrasound with exercises significantly reduces hamstring recovery time (18.3 vs 21.7 days), improves pain reduction, and enhances muscle strength compared to exercise alone.

title: Artificial Intelligence Applied to Human Activity Recognition in Sports and Exercise: A Bibliometrics and Visual Analysis
abstract: Objectives This study is the first to extensively analyze the application of artificial intelligence (AI) to human activity recognition (HAR) in the field of sports and exercise through bibliometrics and visualization methods. Methods We used CiteSpace, VOSviewer, and Bibliometrix R‐package software
sub_theme: human activity recognition, artificial intelligence, deep learning, wearable sensors
ai_summary: Bibliometric and visualization analysis of 432 articles (2001–2024) on AI application to human activity recognition in sports and exercise, identifying deep learning as dominant technique achieving >90% accuracy with future needs in real-time performance and complex scenarios.

title: A Machine Learning Model for Analysis and Prediction of Football Match Outcomes in the English Premier League
journal: International Journal of Research and Innovation in Applied Science
abstract: Football stands as the world's most popular sport, captivating billions globally. The English Premier League, in particular, is widely regarded as the pinnacle of professional football, boasting immense global viewership and attracting widespread interest. Its dynamic and unpredictable nature fuels
sub_theme: match outcome prediction in English Premier League
ai_summary: An ensemble machine learning model combining Random Forest, XGBoost, and LightGBoost achieved 87.14% accuracy and 99.00% ROC-AUC in predicting English Premier League match outcomes using historical match data.

title: A063: Research on the Load Characteristics of Female College Volleyball Players in Consecutive Matches
journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
abstract: This study aims to analyze and compare data such as total movement load, movement load at different speed zones, physical load, jumps, and heart rate obtained from female college volleyball players during consecutive matches. The goal is to explore the load characteristics and patterns of the Chines
sub_theme: match load monitoring, fatigue accumulation
ai_summary: Female college volleyball players in consecutive matches showed total movement load of 816.8 ± 124.6 with initial decrease then increase across matches, with detailed speed zone and physiological metrics tracked via IMU and heart rate monitors.

title: A171: An Applied Study of Smart Sports to Enable Youth Soccer Training
journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
abstract: Smart sports technology can improve the technical and tactical level of youth soccer players through a new generation of information technology, combined with the laws of physical and mental development of young people, and through systematic and scientific training methods. This study verifies the
sub_theme: youth training technology, smart sports
ai_summary: Smart sports technology with GPS tracking, heart rate monitors, and AI-powered feedback improved technical and tactical performance in youth soccer players (ages 12-16) over 8 weeks of training.

title: An investigation into performance monitoring in women’s elite rugby sevens, with consideration towards the Countermovement Jump (CMJ) Test and the GPS-Derived Metric High Metabolic Load Distance (HMLD)
abstract: This study examined the effectiveness of performance monitoring strategies in elite women’s rugby sevens, by evaluating the Countermovement Jump (CMJ) test and the GPS-derived metric, High Metabolic Load Distance (HMLD). While GPS tracking is widely used to quantify athlete workload, HMLD remains un
sub_theme: countermovement jump, GPS metrics, HMLD
ai_summary: Elite female rugby sevens players showed significant positional differences in CMJ performance and High Metabolic Load Distance, with HMLD correlating strongly with total distance (r=0.82) rather than intensity.

title: An Evaluation of the Nutritional Practices and Energy Requirements of Elite Female Soccer Players: A Mixed Methods Investigation
abstract: In recognition of the increasing growth and professionalism of the women’s game (Fédération Internationale de Football Association, 2017, 2019; Petty and Pope 2019), there have been multiple calls for a strategic and multidisciplinary research agenda that seeks to improve the health and performance
sub_theme: energy requirements, female athlete triad, relative energy deficiency
ai_summary: Mixed methods investigation of elite female soccer players revealed underrecognized nutrition gaps and chronic low energy availability through interviews with 47 stakeholders and quantitative energy assessment.

title: Key performance indicators in elite male blind and partially sighted football
abstract: Male footballers with vision impairment (VI) compete in two adapted forms of futsal: (1) blind football, where players wear eyeshades and, at best, can perceive light; (2) partially sighted football, where individuals use their remaining sight. Currently, the key performance indicators (KPI) for bot
sub_theme: key performance indicators, vision impairment, blind football
ai_summary: Key performance indicators for male blind and partially sighted football identified passing efficiency, offensive zone entries, and possession as predictors of match outcomes via notational analysis of 54 matches.

title: Epidemiology, Performance, and Return to Sport After Rib Fracture in Professional Baseball Players
abstract: Background: Baseball players are vulnerable to stress-related injuries due to the biomechanics required to perform successfully, and stress fractures can occur via overuse. Baseball players can also sustain traumatic fractures via collision. Rib fractures are among the most common injuries of the ch
sub_theme: rib fractures, return-to-sport, epidemiology
ai_summary: Professional baseball players with rib stress fractures missed significantly more time (98.13 days) than those with traumatic fractures (47.44 days), with pitchers and stress injuries showing worse return-to-sport outcomes.

title: Classifying player profiles in elite women’s football: A K-means clustering analysis of physical and technical data from the 2023 FIFA Women’s World Cup
abstract: As elite women’s football becomes increasingly physical and technically demanding, practitioners require objective, scalable methods to profile player behaviours and match-specific demands to inform coaching, recruitment, and training design. However, integrated clustering of physical tracking outpu
sub_theme: player clustering, technical and physical profiling
ai_summary: K-means clustering of tracking and technical event data from 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup identified 18 distinct player clusters reflecting offensive behaviors, with 34.5% showing stable specialization and 65.5% displaying hybrid profiles.

title: Perceptions of Biomechanical Devices in Collegiate Baseball Pitchers and Training Staff: A Qualitative Study
abstract: Background Baseball players, coaches, and clinicians have sought to leverage biomechanical devices to inform training load and injury prevention. A novel biomechanical pitching sleeve and portable force plate have been proposed to track training load, kinetic, and kinematic data. The objective of th
sub_theme: biomechanical devices, wearable technology implementation
ai_summary: Qualitative study of collegiate baseball pitchers and staff identified facilitators (individualized data, self-awareness, injury prevention) and barriers (data interpretation, systemization) for adopting novel biomechanical pitching sleeves and force plates.

title: A251: Artificial Intelligence Facilitates Intelligent Rehabilitation-Performance Training Integration Following Sports Injuries
journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
abstract: Amidst national initiatives to advance sports industry development and the progressive integration of information technologies in athletics, artificial intelligence (AI) has emerged as a transformative force in sports science. Concurrently, the "Rehabilitation-Performance Training Integration" parad
sub_theme: AI-driven rehabilitation-performance training integration
ai_summary: Literature review examines artificial intelligence applications in post-injury rehabilitation assessment and rehabilitation-to-performance training transitions across sports.

title: School‑Based Swimming Education in Primary Children: A Systematic Review of Teaching Approaches, Aquatic Competence, and Water Safety Outcomes
abstract: This project hosts the materials for a systematic review on school-based swimming education for primary school children (approximately 6–12 years). The review synthesizes experimental and quasi-experimental studies on swimming and water safety programmes delivered through schools, using Block’s 5C f
sub_theme: school-based swimming education and water safety
ai_summary: Systematic review of school-based swimming education in primary children (6-12 years) identifies programme configurations that effectively improve aquatic competence, water safety knowledge, and psychological outcomes using Block's 5C framework.

title: Impact of Individual-Specific Strength Exercises on Knee Muscle Strength and Speed Performance in Speed Skaters: A Randomised Control Trial
abstract: Background: Speed skating performance relies heavily on lower limb strength, neuromuscular control, and coordination. Weakness of knee muscles can limit performance and increase the risk of overuse injuries. Individual-specific strengthening of knee flexors and extensors may enhance strength and ska
sub_theme: strength training, knee muscle development
ai_summary: Individual-specific knee strengthening exercises significantly improved knee flexor/extensor strength and inline skating speed in young speed skaters (aged 8-14) over 8 weeks compared to controls.

title: KBO Pitching ML Classification - Replication Data
abstract: This repository contains the replication materials for the study "Machine Learning-Based Classification of Team Playoff Advancement Using Pitching Performance Metrics in Korean Professional Baseball" (Applied Sciences). Included files: (1) analytic dataset (CSV, 100 team-seasons, 2015-2024), (2) Ora
sub_theme: playoff advancement prediction from pitching metrics
ai_summary: Machine learning classification of Korean Professional Baseball team playoff advancement using pitching performance metrics (2015-2024 dataset).

title: Data analytics practices and reporting strategies in senior football: insights into athlete health and performance from over 200 practitioners worldwide
journal: University of Limerick Institutional Repository (University of Limerick)
abstract: Despite the rise of data generation in football, the expertise of data analytics within the sport is relatively underdeveloped. To further understand the landscape, a cross-sectional, observational study design was used to survey practitioners in senior, professional, or semi-professional football.
sub_theme: data analytics practices, performance monitoring
ai_summary: A survey of 206 football practitioners across six FIFA confederations revealed heterogeneous data analytics practices, with exploratory data analysis being most common (90%) and limited adoption of advanced modelling and forecasting techniques (54%).

title: Attitudes towards chiropractic: an analysis of written comments from a survey of Canadian sport and exercise medicine physicians
abstract: Objective: To analyze and discuss the written survey comments of Canadian sport and exercise medicine physicians (CSPs) and their attitudes towards chiropractic, including its use for the treatment of athletes and/or Canadians who participate in sports or exercise. Study Design: Online survey. Subje
sub_theme: Physician attitudes towards chiropractic in sports medicine
ai_summary: Qualitative analysis of 27 Canadian sport and exercise medicine physicians' written survey comments revealing six themes about chiropractic, including concerns about variability, training, and ethical issues.

title: A107: Multidimensional Influencing Factors and Psychosocial Mechanisms of Eating Disorders in Female Athletes
journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
abstract: Eating disorders (ED) are prevalent mental health conditions that significantly threaten the physical and psychological well-being of female athletes. The risk of ED is driven by the interplay of multiple factors, including sport-specific training environments, psychological vulnerabilities, and soc
sub_theme: Eating disorders in female athletes
ai_summary: Systematic review of 30 studies synthesizing multidimensional risk factors for eating disorders in female athletes across five dimensions (training environment, dietary behavior, body image, psychosocial mechanisms, media exposure), with higher risk in lean sports.

title: Sex Differences in Resistance Training Participation and Beliefs Among Adolescent Athletes: An Exploratory Cross-Sectional Study
abstract: Background: Resistance training (RT) is widely recommended for adolescent athletes to enhance performance and reduce injury risk. However, sex differences in RT participation and beliefs during adolescence remain underexplored. Methods: This exploratory cross-sectional survey included 108 adolescent
sub_theme: Sex differences in resistance training participation among adolescent athletes
ai_summary: Cross-sectional survey of 108 adolescent athletes (62 female, 46 male) finding no significant sex differences in RT frequency but males reporting greater barbell/machine use and enjoyment, with females starting RT younger.

title: Relative energy deficiency in sport (REDs) in women’s soccer: a scoping review mapped to the REDs health and performance models
abstract: Women’s soccer has seen a large increase in popularity with 16.6 million women and girls playing organised soccer, a 24% growth since 2019 (1). Although research in women’s soccer is expanding, it remains heavily skewed toward injury-medicine (N = 521 studies), while interdisciplinary areas such as
sub_theme: relative energy deficiency in sport, low energy availability
ai_summary: Scoping review mapping relative energy deficiency in sport (REDs) and low energy availability in women's soccer, identifying significant research gaps in nutrition, illness, and integrated performance analysis.

title: Playing Through Pain: Associations Between Pain Intensity, Pain Interference, and Mental Health Outcomes in Collegiate Athletes
abstract: Due to the physical demands and cultural norms of competitive sport, collegiate athletes often report playing through pain. Understanding the psychological consequences of this pain is important for sport psychology professionals to support athlete well-being. The purpose of this study was to charac
sub_theme: pain, depression, anxiety in collegiate athletes
ai_summary: Structural equation modeling of 3,552 collegiate athletes demonstrates pain intensity predicts pain interference, which significantly predicts depression and anxiety, with differences across contact sport and gender.

title: Cognitive Neuroscience in Alpine Skiing: Introducing Computational Sports Medicine for Performance Optimization
journal: Scandinavian Journal of Medicine and Science in Sports
abstract: ABSTRACT While sport psychology has long emphasized mental and cognitive aspects of performance, sports medicine has traditionally focused on musculoskeletal and physiological aspects, largely overlooking the brain's central role in athletic performance. This narrative review aims to bridge this gap
sub_theme: cognitive neuroscience and working memory in alpine skiing
ai_summary: This narrative review proposes Computational Sports Medicine, integrating cognitive neuroscience with physiological and biomechanical measures in alpine skiing, emphasizing working memory updating and offering frameworks for performance optimization, injury prevention, and return-to-play decisions.

title: Revisión sistemática de las intervenciones cognitivo–conductuales basadas en mindfulness en la mejora del rendimiento deportivo en jóvenes atletas
abstract: Introduction: athletic performance in young athletes depended on the interaction of physical, technical, and psychological factors, with recent years showing growing interest in mindfulness-based cognitive–behavioral interventions as strategies to optimize performance and psychological well-being in
sub_theme: mindfulness-based cognitive-behavioral interventions in youth athletes
ai_summary: A systematic review of 20 studies (2021–2025) found that mindfulness-based cognitive-behavioral interventions significantly improved athletic performance in young athletes, particularly by reducing competitive anxiety, enhancing attention, and promoting flow state through psychological flexibility mechanisms.

title: A065: Effect of Mental Fatigue on Lower Limb Biomechanics and ACL Injury Risk in Basketball Players
journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
abstract: Anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injuries are prevalent among basketball players, particularly during abrupt stop-jump actions. While most existing studies have focused on the impact of physical fatigue on athletic performance, the role of mental fatigue has been largely overlooked. High-intensity g
sub_theme: mental fatigue and ACL injury risk in basketball
ai_summary: A controlled study of 38 basketball players using motion capture and EMG found that mental fatigue induced by cognitive tasks significantly decreased knee flexion angle, internal rotation, and muscle activation, increasing potential ACL injury risk during stop-jump actions.

title: Sparta Science Force Plate Assessment of Recovery Following Anterior Cruciate Ligament Reconstruction
abstract: Objectives: The Sparta Science force plate is a recent technology which provides kinetic information derived from movements such as vertical jump and balance tests. Until now this has been utilised to assess fitness amongst athletic and military populations. The outputs from this system may be usefu
sub_theme: ACL reconstruction return-to-sport assessment, force plate reliability
ai_summary: Force plate metrics showed moderate to excellent reliability for assessing return-to-sport readiness in ACL reconstruction patients at 9 months postoperatively, with kinetic profiles (load, explode, drive) differentiating from healthy population norms.

title: Running Practices in the Light of Virtue Ethics (review of S. Little's book "Control Running: Why Good People Become Better Runners")
abstract: The article presents an overview of the monograph of the American philosopher and record holder in stayer running S. Little "The examined run: why good people make better runners" (2024), which has not been translated into Russian and has not been introduced into the field of domestic research of th
sub_theme: virtue ethics, moral character development in endurance running
ai_summary: Book review explores how virtue ethics and character development through running practice contribute to athlete development, identifying vicious traits (pride, envy) and virtues (generosity, perseverance) relevant to distance running performance.

title: Factors Affecting Return to Play in Athletes With Foot and Ankle Injuries.
abstract: Recovery from injury for athletes is a multifaceted process that requires physiologic healing of the injury and psychological readiness. Although the individual injury will dictate the terms of healing and different injuries require different recoveries, healing or near-healing of the orthopaedic in
sub_theme: foot and ankle injuries, return-to-play psychology and physiology
ai_summary: Review identifies multifaceted factors affecting return-to-play in foot and ankle injuries, emphasizing physiologic healing, psychological readiness, and interdisciplinary team approaches involving surgeons, therapists, and trainers.

title: From injury to comeback: A systematic review of machine learning models predicting return to sport in athletes
abstract: Objective This study aims to systematically review the current literature on the application of machine learning to predict return-to-sport (RTS) decisions after athletic injuries. The review focuses on identifying the types of machine learning models used, the commonly used predictive variables, an
sub_theme: machine learning prediction of return-to-sport, injury-specific RTS models
ai_summary: Systematic review of 11 studies found Random Forest was the most effective machine learning algorithm for predicting return-to-sport decisions, particularly for knee injuries, with AUCs exceeding 0.9, but identified substantial heterogeneity limiting clinical translation.

title: Injury to Insight: Exploring the Influence of Media on ACL Rehabilitation Experiences of Female Soccer Players
abstract: Participation in soccer inherently carries a risk of injury, with female athletes facing a significantly higher susceptibility to anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injuries (Campbell et al., 2014; Le et al., 2025; Silvers-Granelli, 2021). The increasing participation in women’s soccer, coupled with t
sub_theme: ACL injury rehabilitation, media influence on psychological recovery in women's soccer
ai_summary: Qualitative study of female soccer players found media narratives significantly influence psychological rehabilitation experiences following ACL reconstruction, with implications for coaching and sports psychology support.

title: Early Return to Competitive Sport Following a Surgically Managed Mandibular Fracture: A Multimodal Ultrasound-Guided Rehabilitation Case Report
abstract: Introduction: Mandibular fractures in high-performance athletes challenge both structural stability and the rapid restoration of sport-specific function. Standard rehabilitation following open reduction and internal fixation (ORIF) often overlooks neuromuscular re-education, cervical-mandibular coor
sub_theme: mandibular fracture rehabilitation, return-to-sport case study
ai_summary: Multimodal ultrasound-guided rehabilitation of elite judoka with mandibular fracture achieved competitive return within 8 weeks using dry needling, TMJ manual therapy, and digital home program, demonstrating accelerated functional recovery.

title: Cervical Radiculopathy and Neuromusculoskeletal Mimics in the Athlete
abstract: Cervical radiculopathy presents with symptoms involving the head, neck, and upper limb that can significantly impact athletic performance. While the presence of radiating pain and/or paresthesias may increase the clinical suspicion for a cervical radiculopathy, a variety of alternative neurogenic an
sub_theme: cervical radiculopathy diagnosis, differential diagnosis in athletes
ai_summary: Review article addresses diagnostic differentiation of cervical radiculopathy from musculoskeletal and neurogenic mimics in athletes, emphasizing clinical examination over imaging for timely diagnosis and management.

title: Synergistic Effects of an 8-Week Resistance Training Program and Creatine Supplementation on Hormonal, Metabolic, Inflammatory, and Body Composition Markers in 30- to 45-Year-Old Male Athletes: Modulation by ACTN3 (R577X)
abstract: Background & Objectives: Optimizing metabolic health and physical performance in middle-aged male athletes is critical for long-term health maintenance and athletic sustainability. This study investigated the combined effects of an 8-week strength training (ST) program and creatine supplementation o
sub_theme: creatine supplementation, resistance training, hormonal and metabolic effects, ACTN3 genotype moderation
ai_summary: Combined 8-week resistance training and creatine supplementation significantly increased lean body mass and improved insulin sensitivity in 30–45-year-old male athletes, with ACTN3 genotype as a potential moderator of metabolic response.

title: Efectos del Modelo Ludotécnico sobre la intención de práctica y el rendimiento en la iniciación al atletismo
journal: Sportis Scientific Journal of School Sport Physical Education and Psychomotricity
abstract: Participation rates in athletics in Spain are significantly lower than in other sports, such as football. In response to this trend, methodological alternatives such as the Ludotechnical Model have been proposed, prioritizing motivation, enjoyment, and a learner-centered pedagogical approach. This s
sub_theme: ludotechnical model pedagogy, youth athletics motivation and performance
ai_summary: Controlled study of 142 youth athletes (8–13 years) found the Ludotechnical Model significantly increased self-determination motivation (6.74 to 8.34, p=.04) and improved physical performance in athletics initiation compared to traditional methods.

title: Effects of Unstable versus Stable Resistance Training on Trunk Strength and Endurance in Healthy Populations: A Meta-Analysis
journal: Translational Journal of the American College of Sports Medicine
abstract: ABSTRACT Context Stable resistance training (SRT) effectively enhances trunk strength and endurance but may insufficiently develop muscular coordination. Unstable resistance training (URT) potentially offers superior benefits for trunk function development. Although research has explored the benefit
sub_theme: unstable resistance training, trunk strength and endurance, core stability
ai_summary: Meta-analysis of 17 studies (n=836) found unstable resistance training significantly improved dynamic trunk endurance (g=0.45) over stable training but provided no additional benefit for trunk strength in healthy populations.
